Louisville-FIU basketball live blog

Jeff Greer, jgreer@courier-journal.com 8:07 p.m. EST December 5, 2014
Buy Photo

Louisville's David Levitch gets past Marshall's Aleksa Nikolic, right, and Justin Edmonds to take the shot. Nov. 21, 2014(Photo: , Scott Utterback/The CJ)Buy Photo

6 CONNECT 14 TWEETLINKEDINCOMMENTEMAILMORE

Refresh regularly (or click here) for updates during Louisville's 7 p.m. Friday basketball game against FIU at the KFC Yum! Center.

HALFTIME: Louisville 36, FIU 23 ... Stats here (http://bit.ly/1voxowi)

At the horn - Louisville's managed to pull away a bit from FIU thanks to some 3-point shooting and really solid field-goal defense. FIU is taking tons of challenged shots, and that's been the difference. The Panthers have a 33-percent shooting clip.

Sort of a sluggish half for Louisville, but Cards lead 36-23. Chris Jones showing signs of getting out of shooting slump.

— Adam Himmelsbach (@AdamHimmelsbach) December 6, 2014

1:30 - Terry Rozier's open-court block on a layup erased yet another U of L turnover, but FIU has still managed to keep things close. Cards have 13(!) turnovers.

3:32 - Speaking of confident shooting, Anton GIll bagged a first-half 3. Apparently David Levitch made the starting lineup to see if he can surpass Gill in the rotation. Not sure that's going to happen.

Wayne Blackshear's playing really well, despite his shooting line. He's 3 of 10, and he's responsible for seven of Louisville's 10 missed shots.

4:11 - Chris Jones said he wasn't kicking out his legs or falling away on his 3-pointers, but the shots still weren't falling. He's canned two 3s in the first half, and they've been good looks off assists. He's 3 for 3, with nine points and two steals so far. Better from him.

5:45 - Matz Stockman's been a really strong player in practice for U of L in recent weeks, and he's getting some first-half minutes. The biggest challenge in coaching him so far, Rick Pitino says, is that Stockman, while he speaks really good English, doesn't always understand what people say back to him. Some words require explanations. That, Pitino said, has contributed to his slower learning process.

7:00 - Louisville's starting to pull away, on an 18-2 run, but the Cards have done it with 10 points off turnovers and seven trips to the line. U of L has eight turnovers against just five assists.

7:52 - Chinanu Onuaku with a strong catch-and-spin bucket in the paint just now. He looks so confident these days on offense. That's a newer development. Turnover Watch: 17 combined. Louisville's on an 11-0 run over the last 3:53 and a 14-2 run over the past 5:27. Cards up 17-10 and pulling away.

11:27 - Rick Pitino's not exactly thrilled with his team's start tonight, and there's no reason for him to be. The Cardinals already have seven turnovers and they're 3 of 8 from the field. We're on pace for 70 combined turnovers. FIU's up 10-8.

Pitino just now: "STOP. TURNING. IT. OVER."

— Jeff Greer (@jeffgreer_cj) December 6, 2014

13:35 - Louisville is really out of sorts on offense so far. Wayne Blackshear's taken four of five shots, and missed three of 'em. Rick Pitino's already furious.

15:44 - Well, let's call this what it is so far: An ugly start. Both teams have four turnovers and 33-percent shooting clips. Whoever had Terry Rozier and Anas Mahmoud as the first guys off the bench tonight wins.

18:00 - Louisville's offense is off to a choppy start. Chris Jones tripped on a drive to the basket and looked like he tweaked his leg. He seemed tentative on offense with the ball in his hands.

Chinanu Onuaku notched his 17th block of the season already, rejecting a baby hook from the block. Oh, and an update from Adam Himmelsbach ...

.@kkcards says Terry Rozier is OK to play in this game. Dislocated a finger last game and did not start tonight.

— Adam Himmelsbach (@AdamHimmelsbach) December 6, 2014

20:00 - Good question from my colleague Adam Himmelsbach before we get started here at the Yum! Center. How serious is Terry Rozier's bruised hand after he dislocated his pinky finger on Tuesday night? Well, he's dressed and has his hand taped, and there's been no indication from anyone around the program that Rozier isn't good to go tonight.

Pregame

We're all set courtside at the KFC Yum! Center for Louisville's seventh game of the season. The Cards are 29.5-point favorites in the fourth meeting between the programs. Louisville's won each of the first three contests, and KenPom gives the Cards a 99-percent chance of winning.

To prep for the game, here's our preview (cjky.it/1yStuAA) and the TV listings for the game by region (http://cjky.it/1vSjQhr).

The big news before the game is that there's an unexpected starter for the Cards. Terry Rozier's moving to the bench to make way for ...

Sophomore walk-on guard David Levitch will start for Louisville tonight against FIU, according to @paulnrogers1 and @espnVshow.

— Jeff Greer (@jeffgreer_cj) December 5, 2014

U of L starters

Chris Jones

David Levitch

Wayne Blackshear

Montrezl Harrell

Chinanu Onuaku

FIU starters

Tashawn Desir

Dominique Williams

Adrian Diaz

Larry Dennis

Dennis Mavin
